newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's Petrogal sees rising profit.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's Petrogal sees rising profit.

text.p: State-controlled energy company Petrogal-Petroleos de Portugal said it saw profits rising sharply between 1997 and 2000.
The company, which made a profit of 6.6 billion escudos in 1996 after losing 11.9 billion the year before, expects to boost the profit figure to 9.8 billion escudos in 1997.
Profits should climb to 20.4 billion in 1998 and 30.7 billion in 1999.

But company chairman Manuel Ferreira de Oliveira warned that forecasts were very difficult in the energy business where factors extraneous to the company -- particularly oil prices -- could boost or reduce the figure by 10 billion escudos in any one year.
He told the Lisbon bourse in a presentation that investment in 1997 was seen at between 40 and 50 billion escudos, little changed on the 44.3 billion escudos invested in 1996.
He said that complying with new European Union rules on pollution control would need total investment of 40 to 50 billion escudos between 1998 and 2003.
He added that the return to profit in 1996 had been achieved largely thanks to a fall in financial costs, which were 11 billion escudos down on the previous year.
